contextId.information: It is implied that the priests would catch the blood in a bowl as it drained out of the animal. Then they would bring the bowl with the blood in it and present it to Yahweh at the altar. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: will present the blood

contextId.information: Translate this phrase to indicate that the oil is to be spread onto the bread. AT: "with oil on the bread" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: which is spread with oil

contextId.information: It is implied that the priest caught the blood in a bowl as the blood drained from the bull. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: The anointed priest will bring some of the blood

contextId.information: It is implied that the priest will catch the blood in a bowl as the blood drains from the goat. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: The priest will take the blood

contextId.information: This means to swear an oath without thinking seriously about it. It implies that after the person swears the oath that he either cannot fulfill it or he does not really want to fulfill it. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: if anyone swears rashly

contextId.information: The person who stole is to be brought before the judge and be declared guilty. This can be stated in active form. AT: "the judge declares him guilty" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he is found guilty

contextId.information: This is an implied warning that those who are not male descendants of Aaron should not touch this offering. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Whoever touches them will become holy

contextId.information: It is implied that they will be anointed when they become priests. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. This can also be stated in active form. AT: "when he anoints each son, ordaining them as priests" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and[[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: when each son is anointed

contextId.information: It can be made explicit that this refers to the north side of the altar. See [[:en:bible:notes:lev:01:10|1:10-11]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: The sin offering must be killed at ... before Yahweh

contextId.information: This is an implied warning that no one besides the priests should touch the meat of the sin offering. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Whatever touches its meat will become holy

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "from which the priest takes the blood into the tent of meeting" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: whose blood is brought into the tent of meeting

contextId.information: It can be made explicit that this refers to place where the animals for the burnt offerings are killed. See [[:en:bible:notes:lev:01:10|1:10-11]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: in the place for killing it

contextId.information: These are all special garments that Yahweh commanded the people to make for the priests. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the breastpiece ... the turban ... the golden plate, the holy crown

contextId.information: It is implied that Aaron and his sons presented the offering. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "they waved them before Yahweh as a wave offering" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: waved them before Yahweh as a wave offering

contextId.information: This implies that they caught the blood in a bowl as the blood drained from the animal. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: sons of Aaron presented the blood to him

contextId.information: It is implied that the sons caught the blood in a bowl as the blood drained from the animal. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: his sons gave him the blood

contextId.information: This refers to the first sacrifice of each day. The priests would offer this burnt sacrifice in the morning before any other sacrifice. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: along with the morning's burnt offering

contextId.information: It is implied that the blood was in a bowl. The full meaning of this statement may be made explicit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Aaron's sons gave him the blood

contextId.information: Translate this so it is understood that the portion belongs to Aaron and his sons. AT: "This portion will always be for you and your sons" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: They will be yours and your sons' with you as a share forever

contextId.information: Aaron would catch the blood of the bull in a bowl so he could later sprinkle it on the atonement lid. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: he must kill the bull

contextId.information: This means that the blood is enables the creature to be alive. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "each creature is able to live because of its blood" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the life of each creature is its blood

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) Yahweh will accept the person offering the sacrifice. AT: "you must offer it properly so that I will accept you" or 2) Yahweh will accept the sacrifice from the person. AT: "you must offer it properly so that I will accept your sacrifice" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you must offer it that you may be accepted

contextId.information: This refers to the practice of going back over the fields a second time to gather any produce that remained after the first time. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "and do not go back and pick up all that you left behind" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: neither will you gather all the produce of your harvest

contextId.information: Here "neighbor" means "anyone." The meaning of this can be made explicit. AT: "Do not hurt or rob anyone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Do not oppress your neighbor or rob him

contextId.information: Those who worshiped Molech sacrificed their children to him by means of fire. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "kills any of his children as a sacrifice to Molech" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: gives any of his children to Molech

contextId.information: This means a man cannot sleep with his sister, even if she has a different mother or father.  The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "whether it is his full sister or half-sister" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: either his father's daughter or his mother's daughter

contextId.information: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "he must not come to burn the burnt offering of food on God's altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: he must not approach to offer the food to his God

contextId.information: This also refers to the food that was sacrificed. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "some of the sacrifices offered in the most holy place or some of the sacrifices offered in the holy place" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: some of the most holy or some of the holy

contextId.information: This refers to the lamp or lamps in Yahweh's sacred tent. This can be stated clearly. AT: "the lamp in the tent of meeting" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the lamp

contextId.information: The incense was probably next to the loaves, rather than directly on the loaves. AT: "You must put pure incense next to the loaves in each row" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: You must put pure incense along each row of loaves

contextId.information: "a year of restoration" or "a year for you to return the land." It can be stated clearly who they were returning the land to. AT: "a year for you to return the land to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: a Jubilee for you

contextId.information: This can be made explicit. AT: "repay to the purchaser who bought it the money the purchaser would have made" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: repay the balance to the man to whom he sold it

contextId.information: In this case the vow would involve giving oneself or another person to God. This can be stated clearly. AT: "If anyone vows to give someone to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: If anyone makes a special vow to Yahweh

contextId.information: Instead of giving the person, he would give the Lord a certain amount of silver. AT "use the following values as your gift to the Lord in place of the person" or "give the Lord the following amounts of silver instead of the person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: use the following valuations

contextId.information: The time for redeeming the field can be stated clearly. AT: If he does not redeem the field before the year of Jubilee" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: If he does not redeem the field

contextId.information: Why a person would be devoted to destruction can be stated clearly. AT: "for any person whom Yahweh has determined should die because of his sin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: for the person who is devoted for destruction
